content:
For people interested in system URIs which would include just about any implementer: I've added two new URI proposals to the list for codesystems NHG Table 45 and NHG Table 45 results. http://www.hl7.nl/wiki/index.php/FHIR_AM_Profiles_en_extensies#Beslissingen

Comments welcome.
"NHG Results of diagnostic findings" according to the HL7 NL OID Registry. I did not invent that part. It is already listed with that symbolic name
Can we mention the 45 in there? That's how I always recognize which ValueSet we are talking about
Why not call it what it is? http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/nhg-labcodetabel-45

I thought we settled on http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/ + symbolicName when we discussed to use System URIs at all. I *really* dislike the fact that you can argue about these things. OIDs never had this issue. Note that my personal preference if we are going to be readable is something like http://nhg.org/ns/tabel/45 but for that we would need NHG approval I'd say. Which may not be so hard to obtain by the way but we haven't asked them yet
I agree with Marten. and also the results: http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/nhg-45-DF-results

Today the NHG 'stepped into our office' for other purposes. So I took the liberty to ask whether or not they feel they want to be in control for this. The answer is yes. I will take on the task to communicate with them on expectations. It may take a little longer this way, but it does feel right. It will most certainly lead to system uris of type "http://nhg.org/...." They already have candidate URIs that actually resolve and are stable, but they lack the "readable" part, e.g. /node/901 would lead to ICPC-1. We'll figure it out, and hopefully soon
That is great news. That way we leave "registratie aan de bron":)

Just for follow up. After that little F2F drive by conversation, I've now actually formally requested the System URIs from NHG, and updated the wiki so the proposed System URIs do not get implemented inadvertently.
Does anybody know of a (Vektis/)UZOVI-uri, we could use as a system when identifying insurance companies?

Didn't exist as far as I know. I've added a proposal to http://www.hl7.nl/wiki/index.php/FHIR_AM_Profiles_en_extensies#Beslissingen.

http://nictiz.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/uzovi
Note that I've also added the NHG Table 45 and results thereof and ICPC-1-NL to that same table. ICPC-1-NL is in FHIR core, but just making sure no one overlooks that fact
